alert.note: Alert for Jefferson (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 31 at 5:59PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Kansas, including the following county, Jefferson. * WHEN...Until 900 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 557 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Valley Falls, Oskaloosa, McLouth, Ozawkie and Winchester.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
